update.description:
* Add new WideAngleCameraSensor
* WideAngleCamera contains Lens description that allows flexible control over the projection
* New transport message type to control camera lens, and read it's state

Camera renders the world 6 times in different directions, to cube map texture. Then Ogre::Compositor is used to map the world to camera sensor according to the lens properties

It depends on [Pull request to sdformat #215](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/215/camera-lens-description)
update.title: WideAngle Camera

content.raw: Can you add documentation to the contents of this file? It will help future developers.
content.html: Can you add documentation to the contents of this file? It will help future developers.

content.raw:
I believe you got this bit of code from another part of `SearchForStuff`, however it's a bit better to use:

`set (HAVE_OPENGL TRUE)`

and 

`set (HAVE_OPENGL FALSE)`

You can read more about cmake set [here](http://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/command/set.html).
content.html:
I believe you got this bit of code from another part of SearchForStuff, however it's a bit better to use:

set (HAVE_OPENGL TRUE)

and

set (HAVE_OPENGL FALSE)

You can read more about cmake set here.

content.raw: Remove this throw since it will cause gazebo to crash.
content.html: Remove this throw since it will cause gazebo to crash.

content.raw: Can you remove this? The purpose of a message is encoded in the topic, and shouldn't be included in a message.
content.html: Can you remove this? The purpose of a message is encoded in the topic, and shouldn't be included in a message.

content.raw:
Can you change the topic names to be:

`/.../lens/control` and `/.../lens/info`
content.html:
Can you change the topic names to be:

/.../lens/control and /.../lens/info

content.raw:
An optional protobuf element has meta-information that would be removed with default values. For example, without a default value you can programmatically check if an optional element is present. This gives you the ability to send a message that doesn't set all the elements, and maintain the expectation that the system doesn't set values automatically.

We use default values when the are very important, and not liberally use them for all elements.

In this case, we should ask if a default value is needed.
content.html:
An optional protobuf element has meta-information that would be removed with default values. For example, without a default value you can programmatically check if an optional element is present. This gives you the ability to send a message that doesn't set all the elements, and maintain the expectation that the system doesn't set values automatically.

We use default values when the are very important, and not liberally use them for all elements.

In this case, we should ask if a default value is needed.
ticketed #1749

content.raw: The wideangle camera doesn't show a preview on the 3D world like the normal camera does. If this is too complicated to add to this pull request, I can open an issue for it to be dealt with later.
content.html: The wideangle camera doesn't show a preview on the 3D world like the normal camera does. If this is too complicated to add to this pull request, I can open an issue for it to be dealt with later.

content.raw: Setting the default is nice. Should we set the default value for all values to match the SDF?
content.html: Setting the default is nice. Should we set the default value for all values to match the SDF?

content.raw:

~~~
public: WideAngleCameraSensor() = default;
~~~
